title: (x) sans serif in Dose Magazine - Whitney {Marc O}
content:
Dose Magazine is a daily newspaper here in Toronto, and they use a variety of different typefaces (and quite well, I think.) One font I can’t identify is the main sans serif font used in the majority of the magazine (in body text, etc.) It’s hard to see the features in a small point, but the May 25 edition used it quite prominently on the cover (as attached below.) I’ve tried to use Identifont to identify it, but none of the results have the slanted ends that this has. Any ideas?

author: frogslate
